author: Andrew Eddy - @fastisheddy
title: Trainers cold on paid jumpouts | RACING.COM
text:
Victorian trainers have labelled the move by senior jockeys to refuse to ride in jumpouts from Sunday over a pay dispute as 'disappointing and disrespectful'.
In a letter to members, Australian Trainers' Association chief executive Stephen Bell said trainers oppose the jockeys' demand for a jumpout riding fee.
"Jumpouts have been seen as part of trackwork and part of the work a jockey does to support trainers and win rides," Bell said in his letter.
"As a matter of fairness, it was also considered that the riding fees for races and trials have been made high enough to make up for the fact that jumpouts were unpaid for jockeys."
Bell said the Victorian Jockeys' Association's decision that their members refuse to ride at the major Victorian jumpouts until a riding fee is negotiated was a 'heavy-handed' tactic to have a fee introduced.
"Obviously, it was always a matter of individual negotiation between trainers and jockeys to determine if jockeys got paid additionally for jumpouts and, for example, some retained track riders do get paid," Bell said.
"Jockeys and riders are contractors and it is up to them to decide which race meetings, jumpouts and trials they ride at.
"Usually, if a jockey does not help at jumpouts, they would be less likely to be given race rides.
"This time the VJA and a few jockeys are trying to get RV to somehow set fees for jumpouts as a dictate from above, which is a heavy-handed attempt to pressure trainers and owners into paying them to ride in jumpouts.
"However, as stated above, we believe this is already effectively compensated in the blend of other fees and amounts they are paid.
"Generally, Victorian jockeys are seen as very well treated. In contrast, trainers are currently under more pressure, with major cost-of-living increases and higher bad debts."
Bell said it was estimated that the cost of paying jockeys to ride in jumouts would be about $2.21 million and if rolled out to all courses across the state, rise to $3.25m.
"Obviously, all that gets passed on to and paid by trainers and owners," he said.
"In summary, the ATA does not support the current jockeys' jumpout proposal. It is not a sensible or reasonable solution.
"The ATA has requested to meet with the VJA and other stakeholders to ascertain a fair and reasonable solution."

author: 证券时报网
title: 中东，突发！伊朗已准备好应对以色列可能发动的袭击！美国缩减在中东存在 _ 东方财富网
text:
担心以色列袭击伊朗美国缩减在中东存在
　　据央视新闻报道，当地时间11日，美国《华盛顿邮报》报道指出，由于担心以色列对伊朗发动袭击，美国正缩减在中东地区的存在，同时，美国在中东地区的使馆和军事基地均处于高度戒备状态。
　　《华盛顿邮报》在报道中援引了美国总统特朗普有关美国与伊朗伊核问题谈判的表态，特朗普称，他对于达成协议的信心大大降低。
　　报道还称，近几个月来，美国情报官员越来越担心以色列可能会在未经美国同意的情况下，袭击伊朗的核设施。
　　美媒爆料：伊朗已准备好应对以色列可能发动的袭击，包括发射数百枚弹道导弹反击
　　环球网消息，据美国《 纽约时报 》11日报道，一名伊朗高官称，伊朗军方和政府官员已举行会议，讨论如何应对以色列可能对伊朗发动的袭击。
　　该官员还称，伊朗已准备好一项应对计划，包括发射数百枚弹道导弹对以色列进行反击。
　　《 纽约时报 》提到，有美国和欧洲官员称，以色列似乎准备很快对伊朗发动袭击，此举可能会使中东紧张局势进一步升级。不过，报道称，目前尚不清楚以色列可能准备发动的袭击规模有多大。
　　截至发稿前，尚未看到伊朗官方对上述消息作出回应。
　　据美国哥伦比亚广播公司（CBS）当地时间11日报道，多名消息人士告诉该媒体，美国官员被告知，以色列已做好对伊朗发起军事行动的充分准备。报道称，美国预计伊朗可能会对美国在伊拉克的某些军事基地进行报复。对于这一说法，以色列官员和美国白宫发言人拒绝置评。
　　来源：央视新闻、环球网
（文章来源： 证券 时报网）

author: Salifu Bagulube Moro
title: Ghanaian Lady Laments Over Cold Weather In Norway: "I Have Given Up, I'm Going Back To Ghana" - YEN.COM.GH
text: Ghanaian Lady Laments Over Cold Weather In Norway: "I Have Given Up, I'm Going Back To Ghana" - A Ghanaian woman based in Norway has complained about the cold weather conditions in the northern European country - Kristsyan, as she is known on TikTok, in a video, said she was returning home to Ghana because she was tired of living in the cold - Her rant has attracted some reactions from netizens, who shared different opinions A Ghanaian woman who moved to Norway has taken to social media to vent about the cold weather conditions in the northern European country. In a video sighted by YEN.com.gh, the middle-aged woman appeared to have become fed up with living in the harsh weather and expressed a desire to return to Ghana. She was captured ranting about the [harsh weather conditions](https://yen.com.gh/people/254147-alpha-hour-lady-regrets-prayer-request-travel-granted/) in Norway, which had snow falling in broad daylight, at the time she recorded her video. From her video, it appears it is always winter [ in Norway](https://yen.com.gh/people/family-relationships/256390-ghanaian-man-norway-fumes-wife-attiude-confronting-side-chicks/) because the snow was captured falling on the woman, known as Kristsyan on TikTok. "What kind of a country is this? Honestly have given up on this country, I'm going back to Ghana. Look, snow falling at this time, and it's ice snow," she lamented. Netizens react to her video [Kristsyan's video](https://www.tiktok.com/@kristsyan) has attracted some reactions from netizens, who shared varied views on her plight. Some of the reactions to the video are compiled below. [timroger88](https://www.tiktok.com/@timroger88) said: "I will welcome you back home in Ghana. give the dates you are coming so that I can welcome you at the airport.. Cool down.You've made my day special day." Nana Adjoa also said: "come dear Snow is not good for Ghana light off as am typing come." Mullar umar had this to say: "Go ! The heat alone will send you back , you don’t keep quite n enjoy the snow." Asante929 commented: "Are u not feeling cold n u have this light dress on?? Ghanaian man relocates to Canada, complains about weather In a related development, YEN.com.gh reported that a Ghanaian who recently [moved to Canada](https://yen.com.gh/people/256504-my-boss-doesnt-understand-i-relocate-canada-ghana/) complained about the cold weather in the country. The young man, identified as [Nana Kwame](https://yen.com.gh/facts-lifehacks/biographies/214781-nana-kwame-bediakos-net-worth-properties-cars-house/), in a video on TikTok, said he would never have moved abroad but for the failed leadership in Ghana. He consequently called out politicians in Ghana for making the country a living hell for the citizens to stay. PAY ATTENTION: [Stay informed and follow us on Google News!](https://news.google.com/publications/CAAiED-kkM3VetXoUfGei2K5uIIqFAgKIhA_pJDN1XrV6FHxnotiubiC?hl=en-US&gl=US&ceid=US%3Aen) Source: YEN.com.gh
